intro: Distictis crassa, commonly known as the broad-leaved distictis, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Distictis crassa produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
